catalog_info.title: American Memorials from Slavery to September 11
catalog_info.description: This course will investigate the role memorials play in society and examine the politics of memory in order to better understand the dynamic nature of creating meaning in the past and present from American monuments. We will broaden our conception of monuments beyond stone statues to include museums, national parks, music, art, film and the web. Movies and viewings of local memorials will supplement our seminar experience.
